channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2023090557
item.description:
Report E-2023090557

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2735 was punctured while in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES deconstructed the pallet and removed one (1) 55-gallon drum from the pallet. The crew placed damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon overpack and the released material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. ES staged the material onsite to be processed via R+Ls normal waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2023090445
item.description:
Report E-2023090445

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 8, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint (UN1263) were damaged by a skid and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents, absorbent pads and cleaners to the paint primer-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, impacted pallets and absorbent pads were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal. Damaged pails were patched up and over-packed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023090271
item.description:
Report E-2023090271

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN3272 Disperbyk-161 release from a 55-gallon steel drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 53-gallons of material released to a 58’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot below the dock and a 15’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The impacted trailer, concrete lot, and trench drain that flows to the onsite OWS were all pressure washed. All impacted water and skimmed material from the trench drain were collected and containerized into an additional 55-gallon metal drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE CAP WAS LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER SPILLAGE

item.title: Report X-2023081158
item.description:
Report X-2023081158

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-13
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081158 SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: LOOSE SAFETY CAP ALLOWING LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR SOILING OTHER BOTTLES. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET PACKAGE WAS TAKEN OUT OF THE SYSTEM FLOW AND PLACED IN LINED TOTE. CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER LIQUID RELEASE FROM OCCURING AND PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING. 2. X-2023081160 SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: NO INNER PACKAING ALLOWING MOVEMENT THIS ALLOWED LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR FROM LOOSE CAP AND FAILED SEAL. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX WAS TAKEN OUT OF THE SYSTEM FLOW AND PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2023090081
item.description:
Report I-2023090081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-23T00:30:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-18
  • City: Steubenville
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FIRST CLASS TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 9:40am, approximately 23 miles after having the trailer loaded at Langeloth, the fifth wheel failed and he trailer came seperated from the tractor. The driver was able to stay in front of the trailer and safely guide it to a stop in the left lane of US22 west of Steubenville, OH. The trailer was nose down on the ground but did not cause any leaks. Ohio State Highway Patrol was immediately called to the scene, and National Response Center was called to report a potential release. We were able to dispatch a nearby truck to the scene to transload the product onto another tank trailer as a tow truck lifted the front of the tank to level the product and get all the product off. We received a call from the driver at 12:21 pm to report that the roadway was being reopened.
